channel.title: Automatix
channel.description: I was working on this with Synt[a]x, but I can't be fucked to fix the updater we were using and he wants to make a reflection bot. So, here's a shit bot - Lulz it up about the package names, the spacing and conventions.

item.title: Automatix
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:37, topic:259081”][quote author=Taios link=topic=342118.msg2653600#msg2653600 date=1233698120]

Basically what i would call advanced (for the bots of today) is the web-interface im making for this bot which allows you to control it from a webpage with the password you set, on a certain port.
This interface is meant to give you an up-to-date status on your bot, including the location, levels etc.

Second would be the new and better PaintMotor classes that you can find in this bot also.
Instead of using a string array, a method and tons of other fuckbs to just paint that line on the screen this is now done with 1 line only, and in a better way.

Thats most of what i have started on so far, i want this new bot to be unique and one of a kind.
Possibly supporting the usage of multiple script engine like ScriptEngine and ColorScriptEngine in one script.

Yeah, multiple scripting engines we did with ARGA bot ages ago. It worked pretty good. We couldn’t decide on the style of scripting to use lul…We then got it incorporated with irc(for a pointless reason i can’t remember) and bot -> bot communication which was extremely useful.
The problem with ‘new and unique bot’…most ‘ideas’ have been done now i think.
[/quote]
I think Q-Bot is reasonably unique in it’s kind. (Reflection on applets that remain in the web browser like firefox)

(Btw. change your signature ;))[/quote]

Thats pretty cool =)
@nar, cba lol.

Read full topic

Thats most of what i have started on so far, i want this new bot to be unique and one of a kind.
Possibly supporting the usage of multiple script engine like ScriptEngine and ColorScriptEngine in one script.

[/quote]

Yeah, multiple scripting engines we did with ARGA bot ages ago. It worked pretty good. We couldn’t decide on the style of scripting to use lul…We then got it incorporated with irc(for a pointless reason i can’t remember) and bot -> bot communication which was extremely useful.
The problem with ‘new and unique bot’…most ‘ideas’ have been done now i think.[/quote]
I think Q-Bot is reasonably unique in it’s kind. (Reflection on applets that remain in the web browser like firefox)

(Btw. change your signature ;))

[/quote]'Sif it matters.

item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“ZyztemX, post:22, topic:259081”]Not everything can be new nowadays, the first thing people go to is the ideas that already exist, even though im planning on making some unique things that you guys haven’t seen before, but ill keep these as a surprise.[/quote]just tell us what they are so we can tear them down

Read full topic

item.title: Automatix
item.dc:creator: @ZyztemX ZyztemX
item.description:
@ZyztemX wrote:

Not everything can be new nowadays, the first thing people go to is the ideas that already exist, even though im planning on making some unique things that you guys haven’t seen before, but ill keep these as a surprise.

Also im working on an internal updater which updates the jar at runtime, just without patterns, but loading the fields from a textfile on my website for now.
Thats because i dont want to take the performance out of it.
Hopefully this is going to work pretty well :).

Read full topic

item.title: Automatix
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:20, topic:259081”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=342118.msg2648494#msg2648494 date=1233399994]

[quote author=Mopman link=topic=342118.msg2648486#msg2648486 date=1233399028]

Basically what i would call advanced (for the bots of today) is the web-interface im making for this bot which allows you to control it from a webpage with the password you set, on a certain port.
This interface is meant to give you an up-to-date status on your bot, including the location, levels etc.

Hehe, my (unreleased) bot did that, along with giving you a horrible refreshed image webcam-like view of each screen. It’s a nice idea, but I’m pretty sure I wasn’t the first and so you probably aren’t either. Wasn’t there an RSC bot that did that also?
[/quote]That was on the plan list for RSBot 2
[/quote]a few rsc bots had that, its not new[/quote]Just that people thesedays can’t come up with interesting ideas anymore

Read full topic
